column4: has anybody experienced not being able to click the giant play button in youtube videos in the middle of the video?
yes
i noticed this problem for the first time when someone earlier sent the link http://www.google.com/apps/intl/en/business/switch_exchange.html i'm unable to use the button in the middle as well.
-  thank you very much - i'm in the process of trying to get the play button working for my friend
-  I am able to click both play buttons
as Arsin pointed out - if i switch to Metacity it works!
lol - once i renable compiz i can click on the play button in the middle of the other video and it works!?! but once i refresh the page - not working again, very strange
-   that is strange - I tried refreshing the page and i can still click them.
do you have a link to an example that isn't working for you?
-  I will ask for one - one second
also are you on 9.10 and what architecture 64 or i686?  what flash are you using - i'm using from restricted-extras
He is using 9.10 - fresh install - 64 - flashplugin-nonfree
-   sorry forgot to put your name firs t- hope you saw
so same everything -- you have an example?

on closer inspection I don't appear to be using "apt-cache policy flashplugin-nonfree" shows none installed!  the only thing I have including flash installed is flashplugin-installer.  This is what was installed by "ubuntu-restricted-extras" just after install.

-  Sorry for the wait - i've asked my friend twice now for examples and he's just leaving me hanging so I'm probably gonna end up doing the same to him and just call this problem solved lol.  Thank you very much though
-  If I do hear from him I'll let you know
please do, i'd love to see an example (another example)
-  When he told me about the problem he mentioned flash videos and all youtube videos
see i'm having almost perfect flash (but not quite 100%), that disabling compiz thing is interesting.
-  sudo apt-get --purge autoremove flashplugin-nonfree    and then sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree   made my flash work 100%
see that's what i've been running since installing 9.10 (and i feel fewer issues/problems then 9.04)
one of the few areas i can say that
-  9.10 brought a few audio hiccups my way but nothing a google search and a few terminal commands didn't fix.
